column1: good length at middle, his eyes light up, he isn't to the pitch, gets it high on the bat and it goes straight to long-off
good length at middle stump, defended straight to point
good length at middle, goes back and defends
tossed up outside off, gets low and sweeps on the up to the square leg boundary
full on the pads, driven back to the bowler
full at off middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, tries to hit it inside out over cover, not to the pitch, gets beaten...and it's an appeal for stumping that it reviewed...he was in
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
good length at middle stump, gets on one knee and swipes across the line, gets a top edge that just evades KP at mid-on. He knew he wouldn't get close to that
full at off stump, keeps his shape this time and drives past cover
good length outside off, hangs back and cuts it to point
good length outside off, sweeps across the turn on the up, Rossouw puts in a dive to his left at square leg and parries it to deep midwicket
good length, arm ball pushed across outside off from around the wicket, skids past the attempted late cut
good length on the pads, glanced to short fine off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the front foot
good length at off stump, steps out and doesn't get to the pitch, watches it closely and drops it square into the offside
good length at middle stump, pushed off the front foot to midwicket
good length at leg, backs away and pushes it to midwicket
back of a length outside off, steps out and pushes on the up to mid-off
good length, fired into the pads, worked behind square on the leg side
good length at middle stump, walks across and sweeps it to deep square
tossed up at middle, steps down the track, reaches the pitch and lifts it straight over the bowler
good length outside off,  slapped straight to covers off the front foot
back of a length outside off, deviates back inside slightly, goes for the chop, gets a thick outside edge and there;s no first slip to catch that
back of a length in the corridor, dabbed past backward point
good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot to point
goes for a bouncer at off stump, deviates away as he shapes for the pull and he has to pull out of the shot and let it through

dropped! Rossouw wants to hide at the square leg boundary. Good length at middle stump, clears the front leg and gets a slog out of the middle, but it hasn't gone too far - in fact, straight to the fielder at deep square who takes it, and then fumbled a couple of times before letting it fall to the floor
back of a length at middle, pulled out to deep midwicket
good length at middle, uses his wrists to drop it into the off side infield
good length at leg stump, takes a step across the stumps and sweeps it in front of square, between deep midwicket and deep square
smart. full at leg stump, gets low and paddles it beautifully
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to point
full at leg stump, tries to flick it, gets a an inside edge onto the pad, so the appeal for lbw would never have been given
good length, angled in at off stump from around, chops this late past short third man
what a shot! good length outside off, steps out, makes room, lifts it gracefully on the up over covers. Stunning shot. Had to make all the power there
good length at off, punched to deep cover
good length off stump, tries to punch it down to long-on, bowler puts in a mini-dive to stop that
good length, attempted leg cutter, pitches on leg and slides past the bat on his attempted sweep and rolls behind the keeper
good length at middle stump, pushed into the open midwicket region
full at the pads, flicked behind square on the leg side
full on the pads, turned off the front foot to deep square
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and goes for the whip, inside edge onto the pad and lands a few feet to his left
flat and full at leg stump, it's through to him quickly and his attempted slog gets a thick inside edge and rolls past short fine's right
good length at off stump, chopped to point
full at middle stump, driven down to long-on
back of a length in the corridor, turned to third man off the back foot

short at middle stump, premeditates and runs down the track. Could've played a pull shot if he stayed back, but has to try and hit this rising ball over cover. Gets it high on the bat and it flies straight to third man
back of a length on the thighs, glanced to short fine
back of a length at off stump, sliced off the back foot to point
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and runs it down to third man
full at off stump, pushed to covers

back of a length at middle, hangs back and pulls it aerially wide of long-on where Anwar Ali does nicely to run to his left and puts in a backward dive, Australian style and just about drops it as he tries to flick it back into play
low full toss on the pads, whips it past leg umpire and long leg's slide
good length at middle, steps out and pushes it back towards the bowler and takes off. Misbah has told him to go back and then reminds him of his age
full at leg stump, miscues the slog and it bounces away to long-on
good length outside off, tossed up nicely and climbs on him as he sweeps and catches him on the body
good length outside off, pushed to covers off the back foot
good length at off stump, reverse sweeps out to deep point
good length on the pads, tries to turn it into the leg side, catches it on the pad
back of a length at off stump, hangs back and pushes it past cover's left
gets under this too much and holes out to long-off. Tossed up outside off, tempts the young man who takes the bait. It's pushed slightly wide, so he can't get power behind this. Experience v youth
back of a length outside off, punches across the line to long-on
good length arm ball at off stump, hurries on him as he tries to make room and slap it into the off side. Straight to covers
good length at middle, hangs back, watches it closely and defends late off the back foot
full at the pads, turns it to short fine's left using his wrists
good length down the leg, steps down, tries to push it into the leg side, catches it on the thigh guard
short and wide, rocks back and slashes to sweeper cover's left
full and into the pads, pushes it back to the bowler
good length at off stump, pushes back, clears the front leg and lifts it on the up over the bowler. Long-off cuts it off and throws hard, but Misbah has scampered back for the second

short and wide, cuts it, slightly uppishly, flies past point. Sweeper cover runs a lot of yards and puts in a slide....has he touched the rope? Nope. Looks alright. Good effort. Didn't try to grab that, just slapped it back into play with his left hand
back of a length on the pads, hurried pull shot, thick inside edge to deep square
slower ball at middle, drops it short, plenty of time to hang back and find the gap between deep midwicket and long-on with a pull shot
slower ball, dropped short again, pulls it again, once bounce to deep midwicket
slower ball, back of a length outside off, tries to punch into the leg side, ball catches his bat before he can turn the face and it rolls back to the bowler
good length at middle stump, pushes back and turns it to deep midwicket
follows him down the leg, good length, whipped out to deep midwicket off the back foot
full at leg stump, he's looking over the midwicket boundary before it reaches him, but the ball slides between bat and pad and misses the leg stump
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
good length outside off, driven on the up past cover and wide of long-off
follows him down the leg again, the ball grazes past his attempted sweep and catches his leg...oh in fact it's given runs. Might have been glove
full at off stump, clears the front leg and drives straight to KP at covers
low full toss at middle stump, lifts it back past the bowler, slightly towards long-on who was running diagonally to his left because he wasn't on the boundary line
overpitched outside off, slight shimmy, makes room and drives on the up over extra cover
yorker at leg stump, jams it out to long-on and Misbah comes back for yet another tight double. Good running.
bouncer at middle, hangs back, swivels and bunts it to deep square
back of a length at off stump, soft hands, pushes in the awkward open infield area at midwicket, teasing the fielders as they manage two more
full on the pads, flicked past short fine's left
Misbah makes room, the bowler follows him, Misbah nonchalantly arches forward to let it go and Sarfraz can't get to it because his view is obscured
backs away, full toss at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, ugly swipe across the line, no attempt at getting to the pitch, beaten and just about stays in on the stumping appeal that was reviewed
tossed full outside off, steps out and gets too far away from it as he goes inside-out, bottom of the bat, straight to long-off
Misbah shapes up for the reverse sweep early, it's a full toss, he's already down, it's chest height and he turns it to point for nothing
full at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at leg stump, pushed in front of deep square
good length outside off, punched off the back foot past covers, that sounded nice
backs away to the leg side again, gets followed, tossed up at his pads and whipped to deep midwicket
good length outside off, pushed to point
good length at off stump, driven on the up to covers
good length at middle, hurries back and pushes it straight to covers
good length at middle stump, hurries back again and just bounces it over the bowler off the back foot
bouncer outside off, sits up nicely, easy for him. Rips this pull shot flat over midwicket, just bounces inside the rope
slower bouncer, this time he's through the shot early and short-arm jabs instead of a full blodded pull. Down to long-on
length ball at middle stump, hangs back, walks across and drags it from well ahead of himself and over the fine leg boundary
yorker at off stump, pushes it back to the bowler who sticks out a lazy hand and pushes it past the stumps to gift them a run
short at middle stump, middles the pull shot again, but this time midwicket is back and it's only one

low full toss at middle stump, goes deep in the crease, tries to lift it over midwicket with trademark Misbah setup, but he hasn't got enough bat and it's taken 10 yards inside the boundary at deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, goes back and places it between the to deep fielders on the leg side
glorious hit! Good length outside off, steps out, gets to the pitch and launches it bang off the middle over long-off
dropped short outside off, can't power on the pull shot as it grips and turns slightly, deep midwicket runs in and keeps it to one
good length, angled down the leg side, gets on one knee and sweeps to deep square leg's right
full at middle stump, it was in the slot but Watson was moving too much before he delivered. Cramps himself and hits it straight to long-on
fired flat, good length at middle stump, steps out and gets an inside edge onto pad as he runs at the ball
low full toss outside off, holds his shape and lifts it over covers

slower ball, good length at off stump, but it doesn't deceive him! Waits for it, half-kneels, gets his arms nice and set and unleashes his arc as he slow-sweeps this over midiwcket and hits it into the second tier
sweet! Bouncer at middle stump and Watson is a picture of balance yet again. Gets under it and smacks it over the square leg boundary

low full toss outside off, slogs it into the leg side, straight to deep midwicket...sends Shadab back as he comes back for the second. The throw is good on the bounce but for some reason Sarfraz hangs and doesn't take the bails off as Shadab dives
back of a length outside off, walks across and tires to ramp it but gets it on the pad that lands near the crease

low full toss at middle, right in the slot but he's completely missed that. Is the visibility bad? Don't know, but that has whacked him in the soft area right above his back knee. Plumb in front. He's hobbling off and there will surely be a swelling
bouncer at middle stump, no control as he hooks, top edge flies over Badree at short fine, and he isn't going to bust his knees to try and cut it off
back of a length at leg stump, gets on his toes and drops it into the leg side
full on the pads, slight angle in, raps him on the pads
back of a length at leg stump, tapped wide of mid-on
good length, angled across off stump, defended off the front foot
good length outside off, slices past point on the up and this rolls away fast. Third man has to scramble and put in a tumbling dive to stop this to his right
good length at middle, puts the pad across the line and tries to tickle it fine. Big appeal, but it was going down leg. Googly.
drops it short, climbs back and thumps it to deep midwicket
that was a rank short ball wide of off, but Shehzad had decided to step out, so he has to adjust and it it straight to mid-off on the up
googly, good length at off stump, thick inside edge back to the bowler on the attempted cut
drops it short at off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
flat, good length, hurries him and spins slightly away, defended off the back foot
short ball at off stump, gets on top of it and keeps the hook down
back of a length at middle, nips back and he gets an inside edge onto pad that rolls to the keeper...who hits the stumps and gives away a run as it richochets into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, goes for a heave and is beaten
got him! Shafiq has played out a reverse-evolution of the pull shot. In control the first time, wild slog the next, and this time he's playing it away from the body and drags it on from outside off
back of a length on the hips, walks across the stumps and dabs it to short fine's left
back of a length on the hips, cramps him as he tries to whip it as he's jumping, catches a glove and just about lands in front of Haddin's left glove as he dives low
good length at middle, steps out and catches it on his pads
hangs back this time, waits for it, good length at middle, swept past short fine
short ball outside off, steps out and slaps it past cover on the up
back of a length on the leg stump, goes back and punches it to long-on
tossed up at off stump, steps out with a flourish, yorks himself and pushes it back to the bowler
full on leg stump and he's hung back and whipped it off this toes gloriously to long-on's right
good length, well wide outside off but he's thrown his arms at this
back of a length outisde off, times his square drive off the back foot nicely, it flies to third man's right where Rumman gets across but dives over the ball
back of a length in the corridor, chopped down to third man
full at off stump, punched to the bowler's right. He catches with one hand, and moves his full unit to transfer the ball to his right hand and feign a throw as KP scrambles back into the crease
full at off stump, he's waiting for the angle in to whip it, but doesn't connect. Inside edge, pad, mid-on
short and angled down the leg side, helped on its away to short fine
good length outside off, wants to crunch this on the up past mid-off, no timing, hits it back to the bowler
good length at the pads, backs away and whips it on the up to mid-on's right. Good looking shot
good length on the pads, backs away and gets it out of the tangle around his mid-riff and turns it to deep square
back of a length at leg stump, whips it to midwicket with an angled bat
back of a length at middle, clears the front leg and pulls it flat, but Smith cuts it off to his left at deep square
slower ball on the pads, good length, waits for it and pushes it to Irfan at short fine who tumbles and keeps it to one
full at leg stump, clears the leg, flicks it to deep square
googly, good length at middle stump, backs away and cramps himself for room, dabs it to point
full at middle stump, steps out and crashes it back to take out the non-strikers stumps
googly, good length outside off, steps out and hits to deep midwicket with the turn
good length outside off, went for the sweep expecting a googly, it spuns sharply away and he let it go
googly, skids through at off stump from a good length, mistimed pull to long-on
sees KP, loses his nerves, goes for a seam-up ball outside off. Dropped short, gets on one knee and slices it over point
short and wide, clattered past point, easy peasy
short and wide again, this time he cuts it straight to point
back of a length at off stump, short-arm jab aross the line to long-on
back of a length angled into the batsman who hits it to the bowler via an inside edge onto thigh guard
slower ball, dropped short outside off, punched to sweeper
good length at middle stump, hangs back and whips it between deep square and fine leg
full at middle stump, goes down the track and chips it wide of long-on
this is class! Good length and turning outside off, but he's got on one knee, played away from the body and lifted it on the up straight over the bowler. Unreal.
short and wide, cut uppishly, once bounce to short third man
full at leg stump, gets down the track and punches to long-on
googly, short and wide, cuts it straight to point
good length outside off, walks across and pushes into the leg side where three fielders converge and feel rather dumb in the end as the batsmen take the second on the sly
goes for the bouncer, too short, doesn't even need to duck as it sails over his head
back of a length outside off, steps out and carves it past deep cover on the up
good length at middle stump, flicks across the line with no feet movement but he bounce is true. Connects and it foes straight to midwicket

what happened there! Full at off stump, he shapes to hit this over midwicket, gets a thick outside edge that flies past mid-off. They take the single, Pietersen runs back for the second, Shehzad has said no, Pietersen has run through....but the bowler doesn't catch the throw from the fielder! Both of them survive. Shehzad scampered through for the second and was not happy with KP. That was his call
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-off
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover on the up
good length outside off, opens his arms and creams it to sweeper cover's left beautifully. This is Shehzad in peak form
premeditated ramp, hangs back, waits and waits and waits, Badree drops it short at middle and he lifts it graciously

ooooooohhhh! Googly at off stump, steps out some 3-4 yards, gets to the pitch and lifts it wayyyyy over long-on. Vintage Pietersen - this is the stuff he introduced to Test cricket way back in that famous Ashes series of 2005
good length at off stump, hangs back and is squared this time, outside past short third man
good length at middle, pushes it well in front of deep midwicket and come back for two. No mix-up this time.
full at middle, steps out and tries to turn it into the leg side, gets a leading edge back to the bowler
good length at middle, gets into a weird position but digs out a cut shot to point in the end
bouncer at middle stump, sways away wtih no complications
good length on the pads, pushed into the leg side
good length at off stump, tries to drop it into the off side, bat, pads, and rolls a couple of yards wide of the stumps and KP refuses the single
slower ball, good length at off stump, pitches and deviates past the attempted chop to third man
good length at leg stump, turns it through square leg
shapes up for the ramp again, bowler reacts nicely and hits the blockhol just outside off and sneaks through between his legs
back of a length at off stump from around the wicket, too quick on his attempted pull and it catches the top half of the bat and flies over KP...brings up his second fifty in a row
back of a length at off stump, drops it with soft hands in front of cover

back of a length at leg stump, steps out at it premeditatedly, it sits in the pitch and deviates away, he has to follow it with his arms. Irfan and Haddin are so sure that this is a nick, they can become scales of measurement. But they wouldn't make good ones. Umpire says no and replays show they didn't really have a case
back of a length at middle, pulled to fine leg
full at off stump, driven straight to covers
back of a length at off, angles in and straightens after pitching, back foot defence
full at off stump, clears the front foot and slaps it to long-off
low full toss at the boots, flicked out to deep midwicket
full slower ball at middle stump, shapes up to bludgeon this, checks his shot and hits it to long-on
good length at off stump, hangs back and spanks it clean over midwicket. Proper street cricket slog
attempted bouncer, flies past his front shoulder
short at middle, easy pickings. Puts in a big stride forward and slaps it flat over the midwicket to bring up his fifty
full at middle stump, wants to thump this, no timing, rolls to long-on
drops it well short, Pietersen shapes to whack this out of the continent, but it turns too much and he withdraws, but it catches his bat and rolls to short third
good length at leg stump, steps out and pushes it to deep midwicket
sets up for the switch hit, he pushes it flat and short, so he's cramped and has to jam it out, just over point
back of a length at off stump, pushed to point off the back foot
good length outside off, shapes for a big slog sweep, goes for it, beaten completely - but so is Haddin
flighted googly, full at off stump, driven to deep midwicket using the turn
back of a length at middle, shapes up nicely and pulls to deep midwicket's left
full outside off, dug out to sweeper cover
full at off stump, slams it past the bowler off the middle, straight to long-off
you cannot stop that. Overpitched outside off, stride forward and slammed past covers
short and wide outside off, well outside his reach but somehow he's managed to slap this in front of square and sweeper has to run hard to his right
in the blockhole at leg stump, jammed out to long-on
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch to sweeper cover
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off

googly, short and angled into the batsman. He didn't pick it, had to scurry to get bat, didn't. It snuck through bat and pad and Haddin didn't even move to try and cover that. Two people didn't pick that one...
full at the pads, under-edges the sweep to short fine
good length at off stump, turned into the leg side

he's running in celebration even before the umpire has lifted the finger. He's also the only one appealing, but isn't going to be embarrassed. Back of a length googly at leg stump, Pietersen walks across and is trapped in front of middle. Why didn't anyone else appeal? Was there bat? KP isn't happy, so there might have been. We'll wait for the replays...replays show that would've gone above leg stump.
but this partnership will not even put on a run. Full at leg stump, clears the front leg and tries to launch this over long-on, but he puts in a nice jump and takes it Aussie style, comfortably
good length, fired down the leg side
short at middle stump, pulled in front of square and between deep square and deep midwicket
full at off stump, inside edge catches his pads right in front of middle stump, rolls to point
good length at middle, front foot defence
back of a length at middle, the pull is the easiest shot for Rossouw. He goes for it, rolls towards deep square leg...who has let it roll in between his legs. That's young Talat
full at off stump, drives to mid-off, puts in a dive, gets up immediately and runs again as the throw has missed the stump and flown out to fine leg
slower ball, good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, goes for the pull but hits it high. Poor shot. Flies towards Talat who fumbles but holds on this time on the second attempt after running in from deep square
full at off stump, dug out to point who shies at the stumps at the non-strikers and misses. Would've been close
slower ball, good length outside off, waits and dabs it late to third man
low full toss at leg stump, punched back to the bowler
low full toss at leg stump, punched to long-on
short and wide, slashes hard, beaten
short and wide, steps out, slashes at it and misses again!

back of a length at middle, jams it out nervously to midwicket who could've run him out with an underarm throw at the non-strikers. But Badree is moving slowly and doesn't even pick it up as Anwar dives frantically
oh dear, where have the brains gone? Back of a length outside off, wild heave across the line, misses it

low full toss outside off, tries to club this, bottom of the bat to long-off, Ali comes back and puts in a dive...but it's a direct hit! It looks out! It is! Third umpire confirms the absolute foolery of Quetta Gladiators who now have to get 3 off the last ball. Smith with the throw

full at leg stump, slams it across the line, would've been four if he got it past midwicket....but he hasn't! Straight to Misbah! What scenes! He puts the old barrier behind the ball, lobs it slowly back to Sami...who misses it, for crying out loud. But it doesn't go too far behind and he scampers behind, picks it up, comes back in and clips the stumps. Rossouw didn't even attempt the second.
